sen.j: 仁科 盛国（にしな もりくに、生没年未詳）は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Morikuni NISHINA (dates unknown) was a warrior during the Warring States period in Japan.
Morikuni NISHINA (year of birth and death unknown) was a warrior during the Warring States period in Japan.
sen.cmt: 生没年の表記を訂正しました。
sen.e: Morikuni NISHINA (year of birth and death unknown) was a warrior during the Warring States period in Japan.
Lord of Mori –jo castle in Azumi Hamlet, Shinano Province
Lord of Mori–jo Castle in Azumi Hamlet, Shinano Province
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。Castle大文字にしました。
sen.e: Lord of Mori–jo Castle in Azumi Hamlet, Shinano Province

sen.j: 官位は正五位下、弾正少弼。
sen.e: Morikuni held the court rank of: Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)/ Danjo Shohitsu (Junior Assistant President of the Board of Censors).
Morikuni held the court rank of: Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)/ Danjo Shohitsu (Junior Assistant President of the Board of Censors).
Morikuni held the court rank of: Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)/ Danjo Shohitsu (Junior Assistant President of the Board of Censors).
His father was said to have been Moriaki NISHINA.
His father was said to have been Moriaki NISHINA.
His father was said to have been Moriaki NISHINA.

sen.j: 子に仁科盛能、青柳清長、古厩盛兼、飯森盛春、渋田見盛家がおり、弟に丸山盛慶がいる。
sen.e: His children included: Moriyoshi NISHINA, Kiyonaga AOYAGI, Morikane FURUMAYA Moriharu IMORI, Moriie SHIBUTAMI and his younger brother was Moriyoshi MARUYAMA.
His children included: Moriyoshi NISHINA, Kiyonaga AOYAGI, Morikane FURUMAYA, Moriharu IMORI, Moriie SHIBUTAMI and his younger brother was Moriyoshi MARUYAMA.
His children included: Moriyoshi NISHINA, Kiyonaga AOYAGI, Morikane FURUMAYA, Moriharu IMORI, Moriie SHIBUTAMI and his younger brother was Moriyoshi MARUYAMA.

sen.j: 仁科氏は先祖代々信濃国安曇郡の国人領主であった。
sen.e: Ancestors of the NISHINA Clan had for generations served as provincial military lords in Azumi Hamlet, Shinano Province.
Ancestors of the Nishina clan had for generations served as provincial military lords in Azumi Hamlet, Shinano Province.
Ancestors of the Nishina clan had for generations served as provincial military lords in Azumi Hamlet, Shinano Province.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代に後鳥羽上皇の北面の武士となり1221年（承久3年）の承久の乱の時に朝廷方に付いた仁科盛遠の末裔。
sen.e: Morikuni was descendant of samurai who served on retired Emperor Gotoba`s Northern flank during the Kamakura period served and Nishina Morito who fought on the imperial side in 1221 during the Jokyu War.

Morikuni was descendant of samurai who served on retired Emperor Gotoba's Northern flank during the Kamakura period served and Nishina Morito who fought on the imperial side in 1221 during the Jokyu War.
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角にしました
sen.e: Morikuni was descendant of samurai who served on retired Emperor Gotoba's Northern flank during the Kamakura period served and Nishina Morito who fought on the imperial side in 1221 during the Jokyu War.

sen.j: 南北朝時代 (日本)の仁科氏は、初め後醍醐天皇の皇子の宗良親王を奉じて南朝 (日本)方に属していたが、後に北朝 (日本)方に属した。
sen.e: During the period of the northern and southern dynasties in Japan the NISHINA Clan obeyed Emperor Godaigo`s son Prince Muneyoshi`s (aka Munenaga) commands to ally with the Southern Dynasty in Japan however, subsequently they allied with the Northern Dynasty.

During the period of the northern and southern dynasties in Japan the Nishina clan obeyed Emperor Godaigo's son Prince Muneyoshi's (also known as Munenaga) commands to ally with the Southern Dynasty in Japan however, subsequently they allied with the Northern Dynasty.
sen.cmt: Nishina clanに訂正しました。also known as に訂正しました。
sen.e: During the period of the northern and southern dynasties in Japan the Nishina clan obeyed Emperor Godaigo's son Prince Muneyoshi's (also known as Munenaga) commands to ally with the Southern Dynasty in Japan however, subsequently they allied with the Northern Dynasty.

sen.j: 戦国時代、盛国の代に子供達を北信濃の安曇郡周辺に分家させて勢力を保った。
sen.e: During the Warring States period, his children were dispersed amongst branch families `s (as surrogates for the Morikuni family) to maintain influence in the Kitashino area in the vicinity of Azumi Hamlet.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: During the Warring States period, his children were dispersed amongst branch families (as surrogates for the Morikuni family) to maintain influence in the Kitashino area in the vicinity of Azumi Hamlet.

During the Warring States period, his children were dispersed amongst branch families (as surrogates for the Morikuni family) to maintain influence in the Kitashino area in the vicinity of Azumi Hamlet.

sen.j: 初め信濃小笠原氏に属して武田氏と戦っていたが、1561年（永禄4年）の仁科盛政の代に武田氏に降り武田信玄の五男、仁科盛信が養子となり仁科氏を継いだ
sen.e: Initially they aligned with the Ogasawara clan of Shinano Province in battles against the Takeda clan however, in 1561 on behalf of NISHINA Morimasa they fell to the Takeda Clan whereby Morinobu NISHINA (the 5th son of Shingen TAKEDA) was adopted into the family and became successor of the Nishina Clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Initially they aligned with the Ogasawara clan of Shinano Province in battles against the Takeda clan however, in 1561 on behalf of Morimasa NISHINA they fell to the Takeda Clan whereby Morinobu NISHINA (the 5th son of Shingen TAKEDA) was adopted into the family and became successor of the Nishina clan.
sen.cmt: Morimasa NISHINAに訂正しました。clan小文字にしました。
sen.e: Initially they aligned with the Ogasawara clan of Shinano Province in battles against the Takeda clan however, in 1561 on behalf of Morimasa NISHINA they fell to the Takeda Clan whereby Morinobu NISHINA (the 5th son of Shingen TAKEDA) was adopted into the family and became successor of the Nishina clan.
